column4: Hi, I've just installed Ubuntu 6.10, and I want it to boot up in text mode, for some reason I can't find 'inittab' file. It is not in /etc and 'find' produced no results. Did anybody have a similar problem?
$ locate inittab   /etc/inittab    <- it's there for me..
ok, when I run zoffix@zoffix:~$ locate inittab  I get this: /usr/lib/upstart/migrate-inittab.pl     should I run this script or what?
really not sure, i'm just saying it's ok on my machine so i've no idea how to proceed on yours.. sorry
well, it seems like the script won't even run, because it checks to see if there is /etc/inittab and it is not there =(
i dunno i guess you could copy mine and put it there manually, yourself?? i'm just guessing now..
yeah that would be a decent idea
so are you not even able to properly boot up at all then or what?
no, it boots up fine, but in graphical mode, I want it to boot in text mode
ah i see, but i'm wondering *how* can it boot up fine if there is no inittab ?
ctrl+alt+f1 or f2 or f3 etc
oh right oops to boot i dunno..
hehe, I know of that, I just need to reboot the X without rebooting the whole system, it seems that the reason why I can't find inittab is because of that Upstart thing, I'm reading now :)
awesome, good thinking from bruenig then
are you still here? Can you please paste me that file? #ubuntu+1 seems to be dead for now
